body_text.text: Whole transcriptome libraries were constructed using the TruSeq Stranded Total RNA with Ribo-Zero Gold (Illumina, San Diego, CA) and sequenced on a Genome Analyzer IIx using GA v5 sequencing reagents, similarly to infected CC founder mice lung samples. Raw reads were processed and aligned to the C57BL/6J transcriptome as described for infected samples. In total, 35,785 genes, including 17,894 lncRNA (50%), were quantified with at least one read count across the experiment. Data normalization and DE analysis was performed with similar criteria than for infected samples, with 273 DE genes including 206 coding and 67 lncRNAs.
body_text.section: Stranded whole transcriptome library preparation and sequencing of IFN samples

body_text.text: To verify the accuracy of transcript quantification after alignment to each CC founder transcriptome, we compared the results from this pipeline to alignment to the mouse reference genome for three C57BL/6J samples. Reads that were unmapped to mouse ribosomal sequences and to viral sequences were aligned to the mouse reference genome (Mus_musculus.GRCm38.70, downloaded from Ensembl) using the gapped aligner software TopHat2 (1) with the following options "--solexa-quals --library-type fr-firststrand -r 200 --matestd-dev 60 --no-novel-juncs -o". Ensembl_70 transcript annotations were supplied to allow the mapping of reads spanning known splicing junctions. We then estimated the levels of gene expression for Ensembl-annotated genes using the HTSeq software (2) with the following flags "--mode=union --stranded=reverse --idattr=gene_id".
body_text.section: Alignments of reads to the mouse reference genome.

body_text.text: To quantify viral infection, we mapped the reads to the PR8 genome and transcriptome; and to MA15 genome and transcriptome, using the SOAP2 aligner with the same options than used for alignment to mouse transcriptomes ("-m 20 -x 500 -r 2 -v 2"). For SARS-CoV MA15, viral genome was retrieved from GenBank (GenBank accession no. DQ497008.1). Reverse complement of the genomic viral RNA sequence was used to quantify MA15 anti-genome, and the following annotation was used to quantify each viral mRNA : SARS-MA15_ORF1ab Benchmark study of correlation methods.

body_text.text: The GO-based iso-ontological reference network was obtained by linking genes with at least one shared GO biological process (BP). We considered 1205 GO BPs that were inferred from experimental evidence ("IMP": inferred from mutant phenotype, and "IDA": inferred from direct assay) and had more than 10 and less than 300 genes. The Reactome-based iso-pathway reference network was obtained by linking genes with at least one shared Reactome pathway.

To quantify viral mRNA levels, cDNA sequences from GenBank were used: PB2 (EF190971), PB1 (EF190972), PA (EF190973), HA (EF190974), NP (EF190975), NA (EF190976), M (EF190977), NS (EF190978). After alignment to viral genomes, we used a custom script in Java reproducing HTSeq paired and strand-specific union mode to quantify read counts on the gene level. A global PR8 vRNA level was determined by summing read counts for all 8 segments, likewise PR8 mRNA counts were summed to get PR8 mRNA global counts, and MA15 mRNA counts were summed with MA15 genomic vRNA counts to get a global count of genomic and mRNA MA15 level.

Module the most negatively correlated with PR8 replication. • Magenta: Module enriched in cell differentiation pathway; enriched in genes from Immgen coarse module #5 which was found up-regulated in B/T cells; up-regulated after infection. Module the most anti-correlated with SARS-CoV weight loss (WL). • Pink: Module enriched in lung metabolism and development processes; down-regulated after infection. Module the most anti-correlated with SARS-CoV replication. • Purple: Lung specific genes with weak enrichment for transport processes; promoters enriched in HOXA10 binding motif; down-regulated after infection. Module the most anti-correlated with PR8 WL. • Turquoise: High enrichment in Interferon response genes; promoters enriched in IRF9, IRF3, STAT3 motifs; up-regulated after infection. back_matter.text: Fig S1: Scatter plot showing a strong correlation between read counts quantified after alignment to genome and read counts quantified after alignment to transcriptome. Three total RNA-Seq C57BL/6J samples were processed using either alignment to C57BL/6J transcriptome or to Grcm38.70 reference genome (Supplemental Method). For all 3 samples, read counts quantified by both methods were highly similar (Pearson correlation coefficient r2 ~ 0.99 with p-value< 2.2e-16). Blue lines indicate 2D density estimation. Outliers that were excluded from the differential expression analysis ("NZO_PR8_D2_39", "NZO_PR8_D4_45", "C57BL6J_PR8_D4_95", "C57BL6J_PR8_D2_89", "CAST_MA15_D4_103") were excluded in panels A and B, but are depicted in panel C (samples with lowest viral replication).

Barplot showing raw read counts of paired-end reads aligned uniquely to lncRNAs, coding genes, viral genome or human ribosome. "Other" includes reads that were trimmed or excluded because of quality below our threshold, reads aligned in introns, in unnatotated genomic region or in multiple genes. A large fraction of the reads mapped uniquely to viral genome or viral transcripts, up to 23.6 M for CAST/EiJ infected by MA15 and up to 6.8 M for 129S1/SvImJ infected with PR8. On average, about 15 M reads per sample were uniquely mapped to coding genes and 3 M reads were mapped to lncRNA genes.
